channel.title: Black Mesa is almost here so how about some Murphy's law?
channel.description:
Since BMS is on the edge of release, it's that wonderful time on Earth again where [url='https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Murphy's_law']Murphy's Law[/url] kicks into effect and the universe does everything within it's power to screw with your Friday/weekend plans. Even now this phenomenon is working against a select unfortunate few to prevent early chances at finally playing Black Mesa! If you are one of these people post about it here, it'll be just like group therapy! :'(
For example my weekend was pretty cleared up until a bunch of surprise obligations and other things suddenly fell into my lap yesterday, and now I'll be super busy until Monday! What about you guys? Maybe you'll wake up Friday morning to find your PSU or HD dead. Perhaps a giant storm rolls through the area and you loose power for a few days! Maybe a drunk drives into the part of your house where the computer sits.[/SIZE] Who knows what could happen? Tell me your stories of despair.

item.title: Black Mesa is almost here so how about some Murphy's law?
item.dc:creator: Zen609
item.description:
Certainly short-term memory impairment is one of the effects of weed.

‘Effects’ doesn’t refer to permanent physical damage, it refers to the temporary effects while intoxicated. I think this is a common misunderstanding of the term ‘effects’ in certain contexts.

There aren’t a bunch of old hippies living a Memento-esque existence.

But let’s not turn this into the weed thread, probably getting a bit too far off-topic.

Read full topic

item.title: Black Mesa is almost here so how about some Murphy's law?
item.dc:creator: Pyroclase
item.description:
Eh, I guess my Psychology text book was wrong then.

I’d do research into the matter but it’s frankly irrelevant to me personally, as I have no plans to use weed at any point nor do I know anyone who does.

Edit: and a really quick peek at wikipedia tells me that it’s still not proven one way or the other.

item.title: Black Mesa is almost here so how about some Murphy's law?
item.dc:creator: johnyo
item.description:
The 2 caps on my monitor’s power board had been slowly dying for some some time now, so it wasn’t much of a surprise when they just couldn’t handle the awesomeness of BM’s visuals and blew up halfway through the game.
Luckily I had already bought replacements and less that an hour later I was back in the game.

item.source: Black Mesa is almost here so how about some Murphy's law?

item.title: Black Mesa is almost here so how about some Murphy's law?
item.dc:creator: Crypt
item.description:
Comrade Tiki:

Wha makes any of you certain you’ll be able to download it within the first week of release, anyway?

You think your utility failures or girlfriend visits will last longer than the downtime? I think not!!

Just wait for November 18th, like I’m doing. The servers will be unburdened the night before Xen’s release.

I trust when the devs say they have it covered, they have it covered, and there’s almost definitely gonna be hosting on multiple places.

So crap… Storm took out my power briefly, and my good PC refused to start properly. I figured I just had to get my repair disk and do the repair process, so I got that and hooked up a CD drive. I guess I must’ve knocked an invisible cord loose because now the PC turns on, but won’t actually start, monitor doesn’t detect it, and I can’t find anything wrong at all inside. Add that to my recent sickness and you can gather that Mr. Murphy must be fuckin’ PISSED at me.

Read full topic
item.source: Black Mesa is almost here so how about some Murphy's law?

item.title: Black Mesa is almost here so how about some Murphy's law?
item.dc:creator: Partack
item.description:
G Man:

What if you died on Friday and there were no video games in heaven

Well you wouldn’t be able to post about it here, then, would you…

Perhaps I should write my last request for someone to inform this thread I died before getting to play BM:S if that happens…

It always pays to be prepared I suppose…

item.dc:creator: G_Man
item.description:
Marb:

Murphy must like me all of a sudden… here I miscounted and thought release was Saturday morning (work morning shift on Saturdays). I just looked at the counter and realized I’ll be home most of the day tomorrow.

Crap, I’ve already drank too much to get up early enough to see what the counter does…

Did you just say get up? Implying you’ll be able to sleep tonight?
